definition: relating to or having the power to put plans or actions into effect.
a person with senior managerial responsibility in a business.
example: an executive chairman
account executives

definition: the choice and use of words and phrases in speech or writing.
the style of enunciation in speaking or singing.
example: Wordsworth campaigned against exaggerated poetic diction
she began imitating his careful diction

definition: required by a legal, moral, or other rule.
compulsory.
example: use of seat belts in cars is now obligatory
a sovereign whose laws are obligatory

definition: parkling or shining brightly.
brilliantly and excitingly clever or skilful.
example: the scintillating sun
the audience loved his scintillating wit

definition: arousing pity, especially through vulnerability or sadness.
miserably inadequate; of very low standard.
example: she looked so pathetic that I bent down to comfort her
he's a pathetic excuse for a man

definition: the action of feeling or showing sorrow and regret for having done wrong
repentance
example: He expressed penitence for what he had done

definition: to ask someone to do or not do something in a very sincere, emotional, and determined way
example: I implore you to change your mind

definition: to very much respect and admire someone or something
example: Nelson Mandela is widely revered for his courage and leadership.

definition: to criticize something or someone strongly, usually for moral reasons
example: Those who remember the past are not condemned to repeat it.

definition: pleasant dream-like thoughts
example: He was lost in reverie until he suddenly heard someone behind him.

definition: especially one used by people on holiday
example: As for dialogue, actors were locked in rooms or chalets easily reproduced in the studio.

definition: spending or using large amounts of money, time, energy, etc., especially in a way that is not very wise
example: The prodigal landlord spends the money as fast as he receives it

definition: having little value or importance
example: I don't know why he gets so upset about something so trivial

definition: A solitary person or thing is the only person or thing in a place
example: On the hill, a solitary figure was busy chopping down trees

definition: not drunk or affected by alcohol
example: I'd had no wine all evening so I was stone cold

definition: loved or liked very much
example: She was a very dear friend

definition: having or containing a lot of knowledge that is known by very few people
example: He's the author of an erudite book on Scottish history

definition: to love someone very much, especially in a way that shows a lot of admiration or respect, or to like something very much
example: She has one son and she adores him

definition: an occasion when a crowd of people expresses great enjoyment and/or approval of something with loud and long clapping
example: the performance received a thundering ovation

definition: strong criticism or disapproval
example: His dishonest behaviour came under severe censure

definition: friendly, but formal and polite
example: His businesses included coal imports, banking, chesnut farms, and general stores, for which he produced wine and various cordials

definition: relating to a young person who is not yet old enough to be considered an adult
example: However, juveniles showed a larger variation in the upwards heaving of the chest sac

definition: very tired, especially after working hard for a long time
example: Here, sit down and rest your weary legs

definition: not easy to find or get
example: Food and clean water were becoming scarce

definition: the effect that an action, event, or decision has on something, especially a bad effect
example: Any decrease in tourism could have serious repercussions for the local economy.

definition: happy and without worry
example: I am upset by the author's blithe indifference toward facts.

definition: Vicious people or actions show an intention or wish to hurt someone or something very badly
example: The police said that this was one of the most vicious attacks they'd ever seen

definition: temporarily quiet and not active
example: The political situation was now relatively quiescent

definition: the movement of a lot of people from a place
example: There has been a mass exodus of workers from the villages to the towns

definition: always being careful to notice things, especially possible danger
example: Following the bomb scare at the airport, the staff have been warned to be extra vigilant

definition: the freedom to live as you wish or go where you want
example: For most citizens, liberty means the freedom to practise their religious or political beliefs

definition: not in use any more, having been replaced by something newer and better or more fashionable
example: Gas lamps became obsolete when electric lighting was invented.

definition: showing strong disapproval and not showing respect
example: He made some derogatory comment/remark about her appearance

definition: small in numbers or amount, often spread over a large area
example: Information coming out of the disaster area is sparse

definition: calm and peaceful and without noise, violence, worry, etc
example: The hotel is in a tranquil rural setting

definition: a feeling of hate
example: She denied any personal enmity towards him

definition: the ability to perform a difficult action quickly and skilfully with the hands
example: He caught the ball with great dexterity

definition: the quality of being attractive, interesting, or exciting
example: The allure of the stage drew him back to acting

definition: moving or operating more slowly than usual and with less energy or power
example: A heavy lunch makes me sluggish in the afternoon

definition: involving little exercise or physical activity
example: My doctor says I should start playing sport because my lifestyle is too sedentary.

definition: having a negative or harmful effect on something
example: The match has been cancelled because of adverse weather conditions

definition: happiness, excitement, or pleasure
example: She opened her presents with glee

definition: likely to change your opinion or your feelings suddenly and without a good reason
example: The world of popular music is notoriously fickle

definition: Unfortunately the report was prepared in haste and contained several inaccuracies
example: His father had just died and he didn't want to marry with indecent haste

definition: strange and unpleasant, especially in a silly or slightly frightening way
example: Gothic churches are full of devils and grotesque figures

definition: having a very severe effect, or being extremely limiting
example: The most stringent laws in the world are useless unless there is the will to enforce them

definition: simple and often rough in appearance; typical of the countryside
example: The property has a certain rustic charm

definition: a long, narrow space between rows of seats in an aircraft, cinema, or church
example: You'll find the shampoo and the soap in the fourth aisle from the entrance

definition: feeling that you have the right to do or have what you want without having to work for it or deserve it, just because of who you are
kids who feel so entitled and think the world will revolve around them
example: These kids are spoiled, entitled, self-absorbed, and apathetic
employees are normally entitled to redundancy pay

definition: to become smaller in size or amount, or fewer in number
example: The community has dwindled to a tenth of its former size in the last two years

definition: a person whose personality has features typical of both introverts and extroverts
example: Ambiverts like to be with people, but they also like to be by themselves

definition: in danger of being damaged or destroyed
example: The lives of thousands of birds are in jeopardy as a result of the oil spill

definition: a person who uses the internet
example: She is an avid netizen and enjoys checking up on her favorite websites to see if they are updated, even in the field.

definition: very confident in your behaviour, and liking to be noticed by other people, for example because of the way you dress, talk, etc
example: The writer's flamboyant lifestyle was well known

definition: connected with thinking or conscious mental processes
example: Some of her cognitive functions have been impaired

definition: offensive, rude, or shocking, usually because of being too obviously related to sex or showing sex
example: In the raid, police found several boxes of obscene DVDs

definition: to give a large amount of money to pay for creating a college, hospital, etc. or to provide an income for it
example: The state of Michigan has endowed three institutes to do research for industry

definition: to get or produce something, especially information or a reaction
example: The questionnaire was intended to elicit information on eating habits

definition: a baby or a very young child
example: Infants under 2 years of age must travel on an adult's lap

definition: a feeling of respect or admiration for someone or something
example: She has/shows/feels great reverence for her professors

definition: the quality of being rude and not showing respect, especially towards someone who is older or in a more important position
example: The memoir describes his life with honesty and impudence

definition: a brass musical instrument consisting of a metal tube with one narrow end, into which the player blows, and one wide end.
example: The trumpet and trombone are brass instruments

definition: a group of young birds all born at the same time
example: The blackbird flew back and forth to its brood

definition: to think carefully and for a long period about something
example: She ruminated for weeks about whether to tell him or not

definition: to become, or cause something to become, full of folds that are not equal in size
example: This shirt crumples easily

definition: a thing that arouses activity or energy in someone or something; a spur or incentive
example: This device permitted for presentation of stimuli to all students, with possibilities of computer-controlled presentation time of the stimuli

definition: (especially of a disease or something bad) continuing for a long time
example: There is a chronic shortage of teachers

definition: to (cause to) change from a solid, frozen state to a liquid or soft one, because of an increase in temperature
example: The sun came out and thawed the ice

definition: to spoil or destroy something completely
example: Huge modern hotels have ruined this once unspoilt coastline

definition: almost out of control because of extreme emotion, such as worry
example: I'm worried that he's not going to graduate

definition: the ability to be happy, successful, etc. again after something difficult or bad has happened
example: Trauma researchers emphasize the resilience of the human psyche

definition: to make someone look or feel young and energetic again
example: He has decided to rejuvenate the team by bringing in a lot of new, young players

definition: boring and making you feel unhappy
example: She had spent another dreary day in the office

definition: a long journey, especially by ship
example: He was a young sailor on his first sea voyage

definition: very unusual and understood or liked by only a small number of people, especially those with special knowledge
example: He has an esoteric collection of old toys and games

definition: the study of the methods and activities of teaching
example: Perhaps the most important dimension of his pedagogy was the diversity of options

definition: (an act of) keeping the truth hidden, especially to get an advantage
example: The story is about theft, fraud, and deceit on an incredible scale

definition: without money, food, a home, or possessions
example: These groups gathered clothing, schoolbooks, and medical supplies for the destitute flood victims

definition: a boat or ship for taking passengers and often vehicles across an area of water, especially as a regular service
example: I spend most of my time ferrying the children around

definition: doubting that something is true or useful
example: His approach to psychopathology was sceptical and philosophical; and he never created his own school of psychiatric, let alone psychopathological, teaching

definition: someone who has the position of leader in an organization but who has no real power
example: The president of this company is just a figurehead - the Chief Executive has day-to-day control

definition: communication between people or groups who work with each other
example: He blamed the lack of liaison between the various government departments

definition: the quality of being exact
example: Great precision is required to align the mirrors accurately

definition: feeling unhappy and disappointed
example: I was dismayed to discover that he'd lied

definition: the eggs of fish, frogs, etc
example: He looked at me as if I was a spawn of Satan because I was smoking a cigarette.

definition: ["a small plant, often grown in gardens, that has red, purple, or white flowers that hang down]
example: The gardens also include other introduced plants such as fuchsias, lupins, and dog roses

definition: extremely hot
example: We went out in the blistering heat

definition: in a very determined way, even if something is very difficult
example: I kept at it, doggedly and patiently, until finally I could skate

definition: a wise saying
example: ["He remembered the old adage "Look before you leap"]

definition: showing a wish to help or bring advantages to others, even if it results in disadvantage for yourself
example: I doubt whether her motives for donating the money are altruistic - she's probably looking for publicity

definition: an act of removing someone from a job
example: Mr Ali said the sackings would save the company about $40 million a year

definition: a person who writes descriptions of historical events as they happen
example: He was a photographer and chronicler of life in the poorest neighbourhoods at the end of the 19th century

definition: going from one place to another killing or using violence, stealing, and destroying
example: Witnesses reported gangs of marauding soldiers breaking into people's houses and setting fire to them

definition: one of a group of thieves who carry weapons
example: They had to live, and his methods were the same as those of other dacoit leaders

definition: severe, or showing disapproval
example: She is her own sternest critic

definition: believing or involving the belief that it is important to work hard and control yourself, and that pleasure is wrong or unnecessary
example: He rebelled against his puritanical upbringing

definition: a cover fixed over a seat or bed, etc. for shelter or decoration
example: Many animals live in the forest canopy

definition: a very large amount of something, especially a larger amount than you need, want, or can deal with
example: There's a plethora of books about the royal family

definition: to review by a brief summary, as at the end of a speech or discussion; summarize
example: It will be needless here to recapitulate the tale of Rip van Winkle himself

definition: to increase in number or develop very quickly
example: Low-cost airlines have mushroomed in recent years

definition: a silly decoration or other unnecessary object
example: Nothing but superficialities and fripperies, on the issue of re-armament, have been discussed here today

definition: a wall made of soil or other materials that is built next to a river to stop the river from overflowing
example: The original levee en masse was a system of conscription enforced from above, but it was presented as a spontaneous expression of popular will

definition: a very small amount of money, especially money received as payment, income, or a present
example: He works hard but he's paid a pittance

definition: a small waterfall, often one of a group
example: A cascade of golden hair fell down his back

definition: to get money dishonestly from someone by deceiving or cheating them
example: They swindled local businesses out of thousands of dollars

definition: a particular way of walking
example: He walked with a slow stiff gait

definition: not changing and therefore boring
example: The music became monotonous after a while

definition: extremely disappointed and unhappy
example: He was gutted when she finished the relationship

definition: to (cause something to) shake or move from side to side in a way that shows poor balance
example: That bookcase wobbles whenever you put anything on it

definition: to pull something forcefully with a quick movement
example: He tripped over the cord and yanked the plug out.

definition: to bring together different pieces of written information so that the similarities and differences can be seen
example: The photocopier will collate the documents for you

definition: famous for something bad
example: The company is notorious for paying its bills late

definition: the long tube in the body of a person or animal, through which food moves during the process of digesting food
example: Meat stays in the gut longer than vegetable matter

definition: an officer of high rank in the army or air force
example: Colonel is the military rank between lieutenant-colonel and brigadier

definition: (especially of a business, job, or activity) producing a lot of money
example: The merger proved to be very lucrative for both companies

definition: worrying, without hope
example: The future looks grim

definition: showing a willingness to take risks or offend people
example: He described the plan as ambitious and audacious

definition: A blunt pencil, knife, etc. is not sharp and therefore not able to write, cut, etc. well
example: 'll be blunt - that last piece of work you did was terrible

definition: Vociferous people express their opinions and complaints loudly and repeatedly in speech, and vociferous demands, etc. are made repeatedly and loudly
example: A vociferous opponent of gay rights, he is well-known for his right-wing views

definition: to push someone or something forcefully
example: he was jostled and shoved by an angry crowd as she left the court

definition: the ability to understand and to think in an intelligent way
example: Her energy and intellect are respected all over the world

definition: A fragile object is easily damaged or broken
example: Be careful with that vase - it's very fragile

definition: to put a liquid, usually water, into the vagina in order to wash it or treat it medically
example: You'd be a douche if you did that

definition: great mental suffering and unhappiness, or great physical pain
example: The family said they had endured years of torment and abuse at the hands of their neighbours

definition: the state of being easily seen or well known
example: Most of the papers give prominence to (= put in a noticeable position) the same story this morning

definition: to make a quick short note of something
example: Could you jot your address and phone number in my address book?

definition: to complain in an annoying way
example: She's always bleating (on) about how badly she's been treated

definition: If time elapses, it goes past
example: Four years had elapsed since he left college and still he hadn't found a job

definition: short journey either to take a message or to take or collect something
example: I'll meet you at six, I've got some errands to do/run first

definition: to make something necessary, or to involve something
example: Such a large investment inevitably entails some risk

definition: payment for work or services
example: They demanded adequate remuneration for their work

definition: to burn something completely
example: The spacecraft and its crew were incinerated by the billion-degree temperatures generated by the fireball

definition: a crime considered to be one of the less serious types of crime
example: He was convicted in court on a misdemeanor charge

definition: inclination, preference toward something
example: Before that, she was a biology student with a predilection for fungi, and before that a jungle-trained member of the Air Force.

definition: copy (another person's work) illicitly or without acknowledgement
example: It was shored up with tamarac poles and when the camp was abandoned Paul pulled up this cribbing.

definition: the feeling of not liking someone or something and thinking that they do not deserve your interest or respect
example: He regards the political process with disdain

definition: used to say that something bad is very obvious
example: It was a glaring mistake

definition: to stay in one place in the air, usually by moving the wings quickly
example: Google opens those issues in a hover over window on the right of the page.

definition: to waste money or supplies
to waste opportunities by not using them to your advantage
example: After squandering all his fortune, he marries a young girl, whom he wants to have act as his nurse.

definition: extremely expensive
example: He continued to drink of the poisonous rank beverages served at extortionate prices.

definition: alone, single; unsociable
example: Researchers had long thought they were solitary, nocturnal hunters.

definition: impossible
too great to be overcome.
example: By the end of the summer, the anxiety had become insurmountable and he left his job.

definition: (the making of) a remark or remarks that suggest something sexual or something unpleasant but do not refer to it directly
example: There's always an element of sexual innuendo in our conversations

definition: the process or practice of using another person's ideas or work and pretending that it is your own
example: The techniques for detecting plagiarism are becoming increasingly advanced

definition: to stop something from happening or someone from doing something
example: Our holiday plans were thwarted by the airline pilots' strike

definition: fear or worry about what is going to happen
example: We view future developments with some trepidation

definition: having unlimited power and able to do anything
example: How can a loving, omnipotent God permit disease, war and suffering?

definition: to help someone or something to be free
example: They said they sent troops in to liberate the people/the country from a dictator.

definition: dispute
quarrel about an unimportant matter.
example: Every so often, the spat between the two digital operations reemerges.

definition: a show of anger, worry, or excitement that is unnecessary or greater than the situation deserves
example: It's all a fuss about nothing

definition: (especially of animals) not able to walk correctly because of physical injury to or weakness in the legs or feet
example: While not a huge shift, this is the opposite of what typically happens in the lame-duck period.

definition: to keep one thing separate from another
example: The psychiatric section is segregated from the rest of the prison

definition: strange or unnatural and making you feel frightened
example: Those algorithms are very powerful, and yet somehow not powerful enough to avoid making recommendations that are creepy.

definition: peaceful and calm; worried by nothing
example: She has a lovely serene face

definition: an injury or mark where the skin has not been broken but is darker in colour, often as a result of being hit by something
example: His arms and back were covered in bruises

definition: bad person
example: We're still seeing kids with injuries, we're still seeing kids with head lice.

definition: to treat someone in a cruel and violent way
example: The police in that country routinely brutalize prisoners

definition: a funny and silly piece of writing, music, theatre, etc. that copies the style of an original work
example: They did a spoof on/of the Nine O'Clock News

definition: anxiety; mental uneasiness.
a deviation of a system, moving object, or process from its regular or normal state or path, caused by an outside influence.
example: The fish used its swordlike snouts to sense electrical perturbations made by smaller prey

definition: noisy, energetic, and rough
example: Standing six-foot-four with a chest like a middle linebacker, Harms was a boisterous giant sleeved in tattoos.

definition: to remove earth that is covering very old objects buried in the ground in order to discover things about the past
example: Crucially, each flare would excavate some protons from the neutron star's surface.

definition: to develop or grow quickly
example: Love burgeoned between them

definition: dark and dirty or difficult to see through
example: The actual status of Neuralink's research is somewhat murky, and Friday's big announcement comes as ex-employees complain of internal chaos at the company.
